newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bundesbank sets 14-day repo at three percent.
newsitem.headline: Bundesbank sets 14-day repo at three percent.

text.p: The Bundesbank said it was setting a tender for 14-day securities repurchase funds, offering banks liquidity at a fixed rate of 3.00 percent.
Funds will be credited to accounts tomorrow and the securities have to be repurchased on March 5.
A 72.0 billion mark facility also set at a fixed interest rate of three percent expires on Wednesday.
The repo rate has been held at three percent since late August.
